summary: This is an FBI 302 form documenting a proffer interview of an unnamed female witness conducted via video conference on November 5, 2021. The witness, represented by an attorney, provides Giglio-related background information, including her personal history, prior testimony, and lack of criminal record, in connection with the Epstein case. The interview was attended by Assistant United States Attorneys and a detective.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: The witness's prior testimony and deposition are related to the Epstein case. The witness mentions Epstein was aware of her relationship with the man who introduced her to him.

persons.name: Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned briefly as someone the witness's ex-husband was possibly connecting with on an ocean project, in the context of the witness's discussion of her life prior to knowing Epstein.

connections.description: Implied association through the witness's statement about her ex-husband possibly connecting with Maxwell on an ocean project while involved with Epstein.

events.title: Proffer Interview of Witness
events.description: An unnamed female witness is interviewed via video conference pursuant to a proffer agreement. She provides Giglio-related background information for the Epstein case.

locations: New York, New York, United States
keyFacts: The witness had previously given a civil deposition related to the Epstein case, where she told the truth.
The witness has never been arrested, charged with a crime, or testified in court, and denies involvement in prostitution, drug dealing, or fraud.
The witness's ex-husband introduced her to Epstein, and Epstein was aware of this prior relationship.
The witness's ex-husband was involved with Epstein and possibly connecting with Maxwell on an ocean project.
The witness had an immigration-related incident in Washington where she was sent home due to a visa issue, but it was not considered a deportation.
